Posts.Content: keljam1 wrote: Hello All! Anyone out there that had to continue to go back every six months, for several years, that once finally biop, it was cancer?  Do they normally do an exc. type Biop?  It seems to me, from all of my resears on various boards, that even if several years elapse, the diagnosis is usually cancer.  I have been followed now for 2 years, and still have to go back in Nov, I just had a mamo in May.  Can I demand a biopsy?  I am tired of this???  Please advise.  Also, my mother had BC in her late 50's.  I am 50, and have a gut feeling that is not good. Thanks! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: May 15, 2009 10:39AM keljam1 wrote: Thank you for your reply!  Did you get followed at first with the Microcalcifications?  Or did they do a biopsy right away?  I had a diagnostic mamo, and the radiologist came out and said, "I don't think it is malginant".  he then proceeded to just walk away.  I was not pleased.  Can I demand a biopsy?  I know Cheryl Crow had the same thing, nd her Dr. said lets just keep an eye on it, and she said NO!, she demanded a biop., and it was cancer?  What do you think I should do??? I really appreciate any and all replys!!!
